traffic.phaseplan

Class FullyActuatedPhasePlan

  • java.lang.Object
    • traffic.phaseplan.PhasePlan
      • traffic.phaseplan.FullyActuatedPhasePlan
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Delayable

    public class FullyActuatedPhasePlan
extends PhasePlan
implements Delayable
    A concrete class encapsulating the algorithm for controlling the progression from phase to phase in a fully actuated phase plan. Objects of this class may be created since the two abstract cycle methods of the parent class are implemented. Plan needs to know the various phases in the plan, their order and the time to spend in each.
    Author:
    (C) Neville Churcher
    See Also:
    PhasePlan, PretimedPhasePlan, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • cycle

        public void cycle()
        The algorithm for progressing through phases is implemented in this method. Beginning with the first phase, and continuing with each phase in order, each phase is taken through its minimum green interval. When a phase is started, a Delay object is created and activated to return after the current phase's green interval is over, at which time the delayElapsed method is called.
        Specified by:
        cycle in class PhasePlan
        See Also:
        PretimedPhasePlan.cycle(), delayElapsed(traffic.misc.Delay), Delayable

      • cycle

        public void cycle(int numCycles)
        The algorithm for progressing through phases is implemented in this method. Beginning with the first phase, and continuing with each phase in order, each phase is taken through its minimum green interval. When a phase is started, a Delay object is created and activated to return after the current phase's green interval is over, at which time the delayElapsed method is called.
        Specified by:
        cycle in class PhasePlan
        Parameters:
        numCycles - number of complete cycles through the entire plan to be performed (must be non-negative).
        See Also:
        PretimedPhasePlan.cycle(int), delayElapsed(traffic.misc.Delay), Delayable

      • delayElapsed

        public void delayElapsed(Delay d)
        Callback method which is activated when a Delay elapses. This method is never (and should never be) invoked any other way. Here the detectors should be polled and any other necessary actions taken so that things are set up for the cycle method to decide whether to switch phases. This method must be implemented in order for the class to implement the Delayable interface.
        Specified by:
        delayElapsed in interface Delayable
        Parameters:
        d - Delay object which has just called us.
        See Also:
        Delayable, Delay
